I love your yoga channel so much ❤️ I am now 10 weeks pregnant and I’ve switched to prenatal yoga but I miss your videos. Any chance you know some pregnant women and want to do a few prenatal yoga sessions. Or are you videos still safe for pregnancy?

Hi Kimberly! In general, most women are able to continue a regular practice through month eight if they avoid twists below the neck, core activation and anything on the belly. Most will find they will know when something isn't right. Hip openers are good but go easier in third trimester. Modify core breaks with reclined cobbler's pose, modify belly stuff with child's pose or yogi's squat and modify standing twists with wide-legged forward fold. We also have a Prenatal Yoga For All Trimesters available in the FWFG Membership - https://yogawithadriene.vhx.tv/prenatal-yoga and our shop - https://do.yogawithadriene.com/prenatal-yoga xx

Hi Samantha! In general, most women are able to continue a regular practice through month eight if they avoid twists below the neck, core activation and anything on the belly. Most will find they will know when something isn't right. Hip openers are good but go easier in third trimester. Modify core breaks with reclined cobbler's pose, modify belly stuff with child's pose or yogi's squat and modify standing twists with wide-legged forward fold. As always, consult your doctor/physician before starting and follow their advice. xx

In the Bus
by Grace Paley

Somewhere between Greenfield and Holyoke
snow became rain
and a child passed through me
as a person moves through mist
as the moon moves through
a dense cloud at night
as though I were cloud or mist
a child passed through me

On the highway that lies
across miles of stubble
and tobacco barns our bus speeding
speeding disordered the slanty rain

wearing the last nakedness of
childhood breathed in me
once no
once two breaths
a sigh she whispered Hey you
begin again
